column5: Years ago i had the entire fisheries act for ont.The changes in the act where also sent on a yearly basis from sanford fleming college.All in paper format for my binder.Its been a long time now,CanI still get the act this way or strictly in pdf form.I like it in print to make my personall notes.Is it still available through the library there?
Vin--you mean The Gazette?  we work with a dude from SFC  PDF format for sure--if you want a paper-based copy you will have to call the library--705-878-9319  Jan 4th   Cheers!
Is there still a fee and how much if anyone knows?I remember it costing about 2o bucks in the late 80s.Incuding shipping.Ill try for the pfd file.

I just printed it out myself for early prep for my Natural Resource-Law course I'll be taking in a little over a year's time. Great reference, go to;  google.ca and type in Fish and Wildlife Act Ontario....then  it should and is the first link posted...click print then and you are all set...about a 1/2" thick or so.  http://www.e-laws.gov.on.ca/html/statutes/...tes_97f41_e.htm  Good luck, I got lot's of studying ahead of me
Fish are covered by both federal and provincial legislation, the federal obviously superceding the provincial...  http://www2.parl.gc.ca/HousePublications/P...3379&file=4
